title: Video emerges of Tory staff partying during Covid
description: The footage was taken at a Christmas party in Conservative Party headquarters in December 2020.

title: Suspended Conservative David Warburton quits as MP, triggering another by-election for party
description: David Warburton, who represents a Somerset constituency, had been suspended after newspaper allegations.

title: Canadian Grand Prix: Max Verstappen takes pole ahead of Nico Hulkenberg
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes pole position in a wet qualifying session at the Canadian Grand Prix that produced a series of shocks.

title: Scotland: Andy Robertson says Scots 'have to qualify' after dream start
description: Scotland fans have suffered too much to get ahead of themselves - but captain Andy Robertson says they simply "have to qualify" for Euro 2024 after a perfect start to Group A.

title: Ukraine war must end, South African President Ramaphosa tells Putin
description: Cyril Ramaphosa and other African leaders met the Ukrainian and Russian presidents in their peace bid.

title: The Ashes 2023: Stuart Broad offers no excuses for England errors against Australia
description: Stuart Broad says there is "no excuse" for his no-ball that bowled Usman Khawaja, one of four England errors on the second day of the first Ashes Test.

title: Nottingham Open 2023: Andy Murray beats Nuno Borges to reach second successive grass-court final
description: Britain's Andy Murray moves into his second successive grass-court final with a win over Portugal's Nuno Borges in the Nottingham Open.

title: Norway 1-2 Scotland: Lyndon Dykes & Kenny McLean score late to earn dramatic win
description: Unlikely late goals from Lyndon Dykes and Kenny McLean maintain Scotland's perfect start to Euro 2024 qualifying as they stun Norway in Oslo.

title: Ashes highlights: England frustrated by Usman Khawaja's unbeaten 126
description: Watch highlights as England are frustrated by Usman Khawaja's unbeaten 126 and a series of missed chances on day two of the first Ashes Test.

title: The Ashes 2023: England defied by Usman Khawaja century
description: England were defied by a classy century from Australia's Usman Khawaja on riveting second day of the first Ashes Test at Edgbaston.

title: The Ashes 2023: England rue missed Bairstow & Broad chances on day two
description: Watch as England miss three big chances to pick up Australian wickets as Jonny Bairstow misses a stumping and drops a catch and Stuart Broad oversteps after bowling Usman Khawaja.

title: Pride event drops Howard Donald over Twitter likes
description: The Take That singer apologises for liking "derogatory" posts on "the LGBTQIA+ community".

title: Rare earthquake damages French homes, schools and churches
description: Hundreds of buildings in western France are declared uninhabitable following the rare earthquake.

title: St Helens beat 12-man Hull to reach semi-finals
description: Josh Griffin's red card for dissent cost Hull FC in their Challenge Cup quarter-final defeat by St Helens.

title: Sudan crisis: Five children among 17 killed in air strikes
description: Twenty-five homes were destroyed in the densely populated area of Yarmouk, where civilians are trapped.

title: Teachers in England to strike for two days in July, NEU announces
description: Schools in England face more disruption as the National Education Union announces fresh strikes.

title: Kai Havertz: Arsenal in talks for Chelsea forward
description: Arsenal remain in talks with Chelsea over the signing of Germany forward Kai Havertz.

title: Laura Kuenssberg: The super, never and only (while useful) fans of Boris Johnson
description: When it comes to Boris Johnson, Tory activists form three distinct groups, writes Laura Kuenssberg.

title: Man denies impersonating police officer and stalking MP Sir Gavin Williamson
description: Simon Parry "persistently followed" the MP on two occasions, Westminster Magistrates' Court hears.

title: The Ashes 2023: Jonny Bairstow misses stumping chance
description: Watch Jonny Bairstow have an "absolute shocker" as he misses the chance to stump Australia's Cameron Green on day two of the first Ashes Test.

title: Nottingham Open 2023: Katie Boulter beats Heather Watson to reach first WTA final
description: Katie Boulter beats fellow Briton Heather Watson to reach the Nottingham Open final - her first WTA final.

title: The Ashes 2023: Australia four down as Moeen Ali gets Travis Head for 50
description: Moeen Ali picks up the wicket of Travis Head as Australia lose their fourth wicket on day two of the first Ashes Test.

title: Prince Louis salutes the crowd as grandchildren watch King's first birthday parade
description: Prince Louis salutes the crowd as he watches the flypast with Prince George and Princess Charlotte.

title: Trooping the Colour: Royals celebrate King Charles's first birthday parade
description: Princes Louis and George and Princess Charlotte joined other royals to watch the flypast.

title: Trooping the Colour: Charles's first birthday parade as King in 57 seconds
description: This is Charles's first Trooping the Colour, a ceremony that marks his official birthday, as king.

title: Gino Mader death: 'Shock but no surprise as cycling looks for answers'
description: Following the death of Gino Mader, the search for solutions to make descending safer in cycling will be a long and difficult road.

title: The Ashes 2023: Ben Stokes removes Steve Smith for 16
description: Watch as England captain Ben Stokes picks up the "prized" wicket of Steve Smith for 16 on day two of the first Ashes Test.

title: In pictures: Pulp headline Isle of Wight Festival
description: The 90s band perform hits including Common People on the third night of the five-day festival.

title: The Ashes: TMS reaction to Stuart Broad's back-to-back wickets
description: TMS commentators Ebony Rainford-Brent and Isa Guha react to Stuart Broad's two wickets in two balls on day two of the first Ashes Test.

title: The Ashes 2023: Stuart Broad gets David Warner & Marnus Labuschagne for two-in-two
description: Watch as Stuart Broad gets the wickets of David Warner for nine and Marnus Labuschagne for a duck in back-to-back balls on day two of the first Ashes Test.

title: 'I don't agree - why do Wales need a slap in the face?'
description: Former Wales striker Iwan Roberts rounds on manager Robert Page for claiming the shock defeat by Armenia is the "slap" his team need.

title: Thunderstorms to hit the UK this weekend
description: A yellow weather warning has been issued as parts of the UK could see rainfall of up to 30mm an hour.

title: Strictly's Amy Dowden more positive after cancer surgery
description: Strictly dancer Amy Dowden has said she is beginning to "feel more positive" after having surgery for breast cancer.

title: Valdo Calocane due in court over Nottingham stab attacks
description: Valdo Calocane is accused of murdering Barnaby Webber, Grace O'Malley-Kumar and Ian Coates.

title: Mader team pull out after rider's death as Tour de Suisse resumes
description: Team Bahrain Victorious withdraw from the Tour de Suisse following the death of rider Gino Mader.

title: Four people found dead in Hounslow flat
description: Bodies of four people, including 11-year-old girl, three-year-old boy and man and woman in their 30s, found in flat in Hounslow, west London

title: Uganda: 25 killed by militants in school attack
description: Soldiers are in pursuit of the attackers who are thought to be linked to the Islamic State group.

title: Pettis denies 'Pitbull' historic third title
description: Sergio Pettis beats Patricio 'Pitbull' Freire, retaining his bantamweight crown and denying the Brazilian a historic third world title at Bellator 297 in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Baby loss: Mum's campaign for bereavement unit in son's memory
description: Louise Gray has raised thousands for a bereavement suite at the hospital where she lost her baby.

title: The Ashes 2023: Alastair Cook believes Ben Stokes will bowl on day two
description: Alastair Cook believes Ben Stokes will "go full throttle" and bowl himself on day two of the first Ashes Test against Australia at Edgbaston.

title: Government delays buy-one-get-free junk food ban
description: Rishi Sunak says it would not be fair to restrict shoppers' options during a cost-of-living crisis.

title: Greece boat disaster: People smugglers 'brainwashed' my son
description: Shehryar Sultan was told he would only be at sea for two to three days, before the boat he was in sank.

title: McIlroy using 2014 Open win as inspiration as he chases Fowler
description: Rory McIlroy using "smart play" from 2014 Open Championship win as blueprint for US Open title challenge.

title: Mortgages to go up by £2,900 a year for 800,000, says Resolution Foundation
description: Rising rates means those looking to remortgage will pay £2,900 a year more in 2024, a think tank says.

title: Away from home and dealing with death - students on their grief
description: After two students were killed in Nottingham, others share their experiences of loss at university.

title: President Biden closes gun control speech with 'God save the Queen'
description: The president makes the remark at the end of speech calling for tougher gun control measures.

title: Whistleblowing banker who went to prison speaks out
description: Peter Johnson, who was jailed for "rigging" interest rates, speaks publicly for the first time since being released in 2018.
